qas.question: Has the government of Myanmar made life any easier for it's inhabitants ?

answers.text: has also relaxed reporting laws, but these remain highly restrictive.

qas.question: Does the government allow access to any desired  media channels for residents ?

answers.text: several banned websites, including YouTube, Democratic Voice of Burma and Voice of America, were unblocked.

qas.question: Are there any groups who are able to effectively operate in Burma ?
Why are groups hesitant to work with government officials ?

answers.text: ethical quandary of how to work with the government without bolstering or appeasing it.

context: The government <a0_0>has also relaxed reporting laws, but these remain highly restrictive.<a0_0/> In September 2011, <a1_0>several banned websites, including YouTube, Democratic Voice of Burma and Voice of America, were unblocked.<a1_0/> A 2011 report by the Hauser Center for Nonprofit Organizations found that, while contact with the Myanmar government was constrained by donor restrictions, <a2_0>international humanitarian non-governmental organisations (NGOs)<a2_0/> see opportunities for effective advocacy with government officials, especially at the local level. At the same time, international NGOs are mindful of the <a3_0>ethical quandary of how to work with the government without bolstering or appeasing it.
